info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 1:13PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Transylvania, northwestern Henderson, east central Haywood and southwestern Buncombe Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 113 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Downtown Asheville, or near Enka, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Downtown Asheville, Arden, West Asheville, Mills River, Fletcher, Canton, Biltmore Forest, Bent Creek, B.R. Parkway-Mount Pisgah To The Nc Arboretum and Asheville Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
